intro: Antirhea philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine antirhea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, contributing to its ornamental value.
